channel.title: Web Dev Break
channel.description: Web Dev Break is a screencast for web developers. Beginners and experts are guided through useful tools, tips, and techniques on coding, design, performance, security, accessibility, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Each and every episode grows your knowledge and confidence to help you keep your skills up-to-date and in-demand. Hosted by Eliot Sykes

item.title: Typography Tips: Responsive Paragraphs for Non-Designers
item.description: You don’t have to be a professional designer to know the secrets to making text look good on the web. If you’re new to typography, this tutorial will arm you with a few rules of thumb to help you produce responsive, legible, and beautiful paragraphs. Show notes and captioned video available at www.webdevbreak.com/episodes/responsive-paragraphs

item.title: Make your app safer with HSTS
item.description: HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) is a wonderfully simple mechanism for protecting your users from certain attacks that HTTPS alone cannot prevent. Show notes and captioned video available at www.webdevbreak.com/episodes/hsts

item.title: Use email (not text) inputs
item.description: Prefer email inputs over text inputs. The upsides are optimized touch keyboards, improved accessibility, and client-side validation. There's no downside: browser support is wide and older clients fall back to text inputs. Watch episode online (with optional subtitles) at www.webdevbreak.com/episodes/email-inputs The form demonstrated in this episode can be found at www.webdevbreak.com/episodes/email-inputs/demo Learn more about Web Dev Break, subscribe to future episodes, and get in touch at webdevbreak.com. Thanks for watching!
